# üí∞Ô∏è Marko: The 20-Year-Old German Developer Who Grew an AI Tool to $50,000/Month in Revenue and Sold It for Over $1 Million

Yuma Ueno

¬∑

--

Hello! I‚Äôm Yuma Ueno().

I‚Äôm struggling to build many products (Ex: AI-Powered Japanese FlashCards).

I‚Äôve researched the amazing indie hackers / entrepreneurs and summarized what they‚Äôve done.

I would like to introduce the great entrepreneur ‚ÄúMarko Kraemer‚Äù!

A genius developer born in Germany who, at just 20 years old, sold an AI product for over $1 million. His level of action and drive from a young age is so extreme it‚Äôs mind-blowing. Let‚Äôs take a look at his story! [...] ## üë¶ Hooked on Minecraft Since Childhood, He Started a Business Using His Programming Skills

His talent as an engineer and entrepreneur was visible from a very young age. In elementary school, he was completely hooked on Minecraft, playing it every single day. In the process, he picked up knowledge of graphic design and programming. He used this knowledge to build websites for Minecraft.

Following that path, at the age of 13, he founded a small agency called Blue Page. He started building and selling landing pages to local businesses. He‚Ä¶

Text to speech", "score": 0.7906115, "raw_content": null}, {"url": "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/ellisdotcom_were-at-the-beginning-of-the-largest-workforce-activity-7349483541774159873-19lr", "title": "Marko Kraemer: AI visionary and entrepreneur at 20 - LinkedIn", "content": "‚ÄúWe‚Äôre at the beginning of the largest workforce transition in human history, where 80% of knowledge work shifts from humans to AI.‚Äù Marko O. Kraemer's entrepreneurial journey began unusually early. At just 12, he founded BluePage, building marketing landing pages for small businesses in Frankfurt, Germany. By 14, he had launched GastroPage, a restaurant digitization platform featuring QR-code menus, years ahead of the pandemic that would make such tools ubiquitous. Operating legally as a minor in Germany‚Äôs tightly regulated business environment required special court permission, an extraordinary exception granted to Marko. While still in high school, he went on to launch Plutus, a software development studio. ‚ÄúI essentially missed the last two years of school,‚Äù he recalls. ‚ÄúDuring COVID, [...] With a newly approved O-1 visa, Marko now splits his time between San Francisco and Europe as he scales Kortix‚Äôs broader vision: helping organizations transition from human to AI-driven knowledge work through both self-serve tools and enterprise-grade implementations. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre building for a future where AI agents can perform 70 to 80 percent of knowledge work,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt just automation. It‚Äôs a foundational shift unlike anything the labor market has seen before.‚Äù At just 20 years old, Marko's journey from teenage entrepreneur to AI visionary stands as a testament to his belief that innovation has no age limit, and that the future belongs to those who build it. [...] the last two years of school,‚Äù he recalls. ‚ÄúDuring COVID, a friend managed my Microsoft Teams login so I could focus on building the company. I only showed up for the exams.‚Äù After graduating in 2023, Marko founded Kortix with an ambitious mission to build the foundational infrastructure for the AI revolution. The first product, SoftGen, an AI-powered web app builder, scaled from zero to $50K in monthly recurring revenue within four months and was acquired by a private equity firm. His current focus is Kortix Suna, an open-source platform he describes as ‚ÄúWordPress for AI agents.‚Äù In just weeks after launch, Suna amassed 50,000 users, earned 14,000 GitHub stars, and sparked serious enterprise interest with over 200 enterprise bookings.  6 Articles", "score": 0.5889134, "raw_content": null}, {"url": "https://finance.yahoo.com/news/kortix-relaunches-bring-open-source-180000954.html", "title": "Kortix Relaunches to Bring Open-Source AI Workers to Everyone", "content": "Redefining What "Work" Means

The company's consumer relaunch also represents a broader shift in how automation is understood. Rather than replacing people, Kortix aims to empower them and help users reclaim time, reduce digital clutter, and focus on what matters most.

"The question we're asking is simple," said Gagliardi. "What could you accomplish if 80 percent of your digital tasks ran themselves?"

About Kortix

Launched by Marko Kraemer and Domenico Gagliardi in April 2025, Kortix is an open-source AI company dedicated to making automation accessible, ethical, and transparent. Its flagship AI worker, Suna, enables individuals and developers to automate complex digital workflows while maintaining full control and visibility.

The company's consumer relaunch also represents a broader shift in how automation is understood. Rather than replacing people, Kortix aims to empower them and help users reclaim time, reduce digital clutter, and focus on what matters most.

"The question we're asking is simple," said Gagliardi. "What could you accomplish if 80 percent of your digital tasks ran themselves?"

About Kortix

Launched by Marko Kraemer and Domenico Gagliardi in April 2025, Kortix is an open-source AI company dedicated to making automation accessible, ethical, and transparent. Its flagship AI worker, Suna, enables individuals and developers to automate complex digital workflows while maintaining full control and visibility.

content.content:
Here's what I found about Marko Kraemer:

**Who He Is:**
Marko O. Kraemer is a 20-year-old German-born AI entrepreneur and tech visionary based in San Francisco. He's the Founder and CEO of **Kortix**, an open-source AI company that's making waves in the AI automation space.

**Early Entrepreneurial Journey:**
- **Age 12**: Founded **BluePage**, building marketing landing pages for small businesses in Frankfurt, Germany
- **Age 14**: Launched **GastroPage**, a restaurant digitization platform with QR-code menus (ahead of the pandemic curve!)
- **High School**: Founded **Plutus**, a software development studio, while still in school
- He actually missed the last two years of high school to focus on his business‚Äîa friend managed his Microsoft Teams login so he could attend exams

**Major Achievements:**
1. **SoftGen.AI** - An AI-powered web app builder that scaled from zero to **$50K monthly recurring revenue in just 4 months** and was sold for **over $1 million**
2. **Kortix Suna** - Described as "WordPress for AI agents," this open-source platform achieved:
   - 50,000 users in weeks
   - 14,000 GitHub stars
   - 200+ enterprise bookings
3. **Funding**: Raised **$4 million** to expand Kortix's AI-worker ecosystem

**Current Focus:**
Marko is building the foundational infrastructure for the AI revolution. His vision is to help organizations transition from human to AI-driven knowledge work, with the goal of having AI agents perform 70-80% of knowledge work. He holds an O-1 visa (for individuals with extraordinary ability) and splits his time between San Francisco and Europe.

**Philosophy:**
He believes "We're at the beginning of the largest workforce transition in human history, where 80% of knowledge work shifts from humans to AI."

Pretty impressive for someone still in their early 20s!

metadata.text_content:
Here's what I found about Marko Kraemer:

**Who He Is:**
Marko O. Kraemer is a 20-year-old German-born AI entrepreneur and tech visionary based in San Francisco. He's the Founder and CEO of **Kortix**, an open-source AI company that's making waves in the AI automation space.

**Early Entrepreneurial Journey:**
- **Age 12**: Founded **BluePage**, building marketing landing pages for small businesses in Frankfurt, Germany
- **Age 14**: Launched **GastroPage**, a restaurant digitization platform with QR-code menus (ahead of the pandemic curve!)
- **High School**: Founded **Plutus**, a software development studio, while still in school
- He actually missed the last two years of high school to focus on his business‚Äîa friend managed his Microsoft Teams login so he could attend exams

**Major Achievements:**
1. **SoftGen.AI** - An AI-powered web app builder that scaled from zero to **$50K monthly recurring revenue in just 4 months** and was sold for **over $1 million**
2. **Kortix Suna** - Described as "WordPress for AI agents," this open-source platform achieved:
   - 50,000 users in weeks
   - 14,000 GitHub stars
   - 200+ enterprise bookings
3. **Funding**: Raised **$4 million** to expand Kortix's AI-worker ecosystem

**Current Focus:**
Marko is building the foundational infrastructure for the AI revolution. His vision is to help organizations transition from human to AI-driven knowledge work, with the goal of having AI agents perform 70-80% of knowledge work. He holds an O-1 visa (for individuals with extraordinary ability) and splits his time between San Francisco and Europe.

**Philosophy:**
He believes "We're at the beginning of the largest workforce transition in human history, where 80% of knowledge work shifts from humans to AI."

Pretty impressive for someone still in their early 20s!
